abstract: The bank will pay a total of $137 million to settle complaints over its role in a conspiracy to rig bids on municipal bond contracts.
snippet: The bank will pay a total of $137 million to settle complaints over its role in a conspiracy to rig bids on municipal bond contracts.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Banc of America Securities has agreed to pay $137 million to settle charges from the Securities and Exchange Commission and state and federal authorities related to its participation in a bid-rigging scheme in the municipal securities market as part of a continuing federal investigation.

headline.main: Bank of America Unit Settles Complaint on Municipal Bonds
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Unit Settles Complaint on Municipal Bonds

abstract: The case is part of a wide-ranging investigation into the municipal derivatives markets, investigating whether Wall Street defrauded cities, schools and nonprofits.
snippet: The case is part of a wide-ranging investigation into the municipal derivatives markets, investigating whether Wall Street defrauded cities, schools and nonprofits.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America agreed on Tuesday to pay federal and state authorities $137 million to settle charges that its securities group helped rig bids on municipal bond contracts, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

headline.main: Bank of America Pays $137 Million in Bid-Rigging Case

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
